property.description: Use statically allocated context.
Use statically allocated context for comm interface.
Default Radio Access Technology.
This should be disabled when a modem doesn't support GSM or the AT+CGREG command.
Use statically allocated socket.
Log level for the cellular interface. Defaults to using printf when enabled

config.content:
#ifdef __cplusplus extern "C" { #endif
#define CELLULAR_MCC_MAX_SIZE (${config.aws.cellular_interface.mcc_max_size}) #define CELLULAR_MNC_MAX_SIZE (${config.aws.cellular_interface.mnc_max_size}) #define CELLULAR_ICCID_MAX_SIZE (${config.aws.cellular_interface.iccid_max_size}) #define CELLULAR_IMSI_MAX_SIZE (${config.aws.cellular_interface.imsi_max_size}) #define CELLULAR_FW_VERSION_MAX_SIZE (${config.aws.cellular_interface.fw_version_max_size}) #define CELLULAR_HW_VERSION_MAX_SIZE (${config.aws.cellular_interface.hw_version_max_size}) #define CELLULAR_SERIAL_NUM_MAX_SIZE (${config.aws.cellular_interface.serial_num_max_size}) #define CELLULAR_IMEI_MAX_SIZE (${config.aws.cellular_interface.imei_max_size}) #define CELLULAR_NETWORK_NAME_MAX_SIZE (${config.aws.cellular_interface.network_name_max_size}) #define CELLULAR_APN_MAX_SIZE (${config.aws.cellular_interface.apn_max_size}) #define CELLULAR_PDN_USERNAME_MAX_SIZE (${config.aws.cellular_interface.pdn_username_max_size}) #define CELLULAR_PDN_PASSWORD_MAX_SIZE (${config.aws.cellular_interface.pdn_password_max_size}) #define CELLULAR_IP_ADDRESS_MAX_SIZE (${config.aws.cellular_interface.ip_addr_max_size}) #define CELLULAR_AT_CMD_MAX_SIZE (${config.aws.cellular_interface.at_cmd_max_size}) #define CELLULAR_NUM_SOCKET_MAX (${config.aws.cellular_interface.num_sockets_max_size}) #define CELLULAR_MANUFACTURE_ID_MAX_SIZE (${config.aws.cellular_interface.manufacture_id_max_size}) #define CELLULAR_MODEL_ID_MAX_SIZE (${config.aws.cellular_interface.model_id_max_size}) #define CELLULAR_EDRX_LIST_MAX_SIZE (${config.aws.cellular_interface.edrx_list_max_size}) #define CELLULAR_PDN_CONTEXT_ID_MIN (${config.aws.cellular_interface.pdn_context_id_min}) #define CELLULAR_PDN_CONTEXT_ID_MAX (${config.aws.cellular_interface.pdn_context_id_max}) #define CELLULAR_MAX_RAT_PRIORITY_COUNT (${config.aws.cellular_interface.max_rat_prority_count}) #define CELLULAR_MAX_SEND_DATA_LEN (${config.aws.cellular_interface.max_send_data_len}) #define CELLULAR_MAX_RECV_DATA_LEN (${config.aws.cellular_interface.max_recv_data_len}) #define CELLULAR_SUPPORT_GETHOSTBYNAME (${config.aws.cellular_interface.support_get_host_by_name}) #define CELLULAR_COMM_IF_SEND_TIMEOUT_MS (${config.aws.cellular_interface.comm_if_send_timeout}) #define CELLULAR_COMM_IF_RECV_TIMEOUT_MS (${config.aws.cellular_interface.comm_if_recv_timeout}) #define CELLULAR_CONFIG_STATIC_ALLOCATION_CONTEXT (${config.aws.cellular_interface.static_allocation_context}) #define CELLULAR_CONFIG_STATIC_COMM_CONTEXT_ALLOCATION (${config.aws.cellular_interface.comm_static_allocation_context}) #define CELLULAR_CONFIG_DEFAULT_RAT (${config.aws.cellular_interface.default_rat}) #define CELLULAR_CONFIG_STATIC_SOCKET_CONTEXT_ALLOCATION (${config.aws.cellular_interface.static_socket_context}) ${config.aws.cellular_interface.gsm}
#define CELLULAR_LOG_LEVEL_OFF 0 #define CELLULAR_LOG_LEVEL_ERROR 1 #define CELLULAR_LOG_LEVEL_WARNING 2 #define CELLULAR_LOG_LEVEL_INFO 3 #define CELLULAR_LOG_LEVEL_DEBUG 4
${config.aws.cellular_interface.log_level}
/* * The compiled log level determines the maximum level that can be * printed. */ #ifndef CELLULAR_LOG_LEVEL #define CELLULAR_LOG_LEVEL CELLULAR_LOG_LEVEL_OFF #endif
#ifndef CELLULAR_LOG_PRINTF #include <stdio.h> #define CELLULAR_LOG_PRINTF(_fmt, ...) printf(_fmt "\n", ## __VA_ARGS__) #endif
#ifndef LogError #if CELLULAR_LOG_LEVEL >= CELLULAR_LOG_LEVEL_ERROR #define LogError(message) CELLULAR_LOG_PRINTF message #else #define LogError(...) #endif #endif
#ifndef LogWarn #if CELLULAR_LOG_LEVEL >= CELLULAR_LOG_LEVEL_WARNING #define LogWarn(message) CELLULAR_LOG_PRINTF message #else #define LogWarn(...) #endif #endif
#ifndef LogInfo #if CELLULAR_LOG_LEVEL >= CELLULAR_LOG_LEVEL_INFO #define LogInfo(message) CELLULAR_LOG_PRINTF message #else #define LogInfo(...) #endif #endif
#ifndef LogDebug #if CELLULAR_LOG_LEVEL >= CELLULAR_LOG_LEVEL_DEBUG #define LogDebug(message) CELLULAR_LOG_PRINTF message #else #define LogDebug(...) #endif #endif
#ifdef __cplusplus } #endif
